intro: Hieracium atratum subsp. ussense, commonly known as the black hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dark green, hairy leaves and yellow flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers bloom in late summer, producing a showy display that attracts pollinators. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly different leaf morphology and habitat preferences compared to other members of the species.
